hmPIMMIB.name: hmPIMMIB
hmPIMMIB.contactinfo: Customer Support Postal: Hirschmann Automation and Control GmbH Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Tel: +49 7127 14 1981 Web: http://www.hicomcenter.com/ E-Mail: hicomcenter@hirschmann.com
hmPIMMIB.description: The Hirschmann Private Platform4 PIM MIB definitions for Platform devices.

hmPIMJoinPruneInterval.name: hmPIMJoinPruneInterval
hmPIMJoinPruneInterval.description: The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune messages are to be sent.

hmPIMInterfaceTable.name: hmPIMInterfaceTable
hmPIMInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces. IGMP and PIM are enabled on all interfaces listed in this table.

hmPIMInterfaceEntry.name: hmPIMInterfaceEntry
hmPIMInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMInterfaceTable.

hmPIMInterfaceIfIndex.name: hmPIMInterfaceIfIndex
hmPIMInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

hmPIMInterfaceAddress.name: hmPIMInterfaceAddress
hmPIMInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

hmPIMInterfaceNetMask.name: hmPIMInterfaceNetMask
hmPIMInterfaceNetMask.description: The network mask for the IP address of the PIM interface.

hmPIMInterfaceMode.name: hmPIMInterfaceMode
hmPIMInterfaceMode.description: The configured mode of this PIM interface. A value of sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

hmPIMInterfaceDR.name: hmPIMInterfaceDR
hmPIMInterfaceDR.description: The Designated Router on this PIM interface. For point-to- point interfaces, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

hmPIMInterfaceHelloInterval.name: hmPIMInterfaceHelloInterval
hmPIMInterfaceHelloInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted on this interface.

hmPIMInterfaceStatus.name: hmPIMInterfaceStatus
hmPIMInterfaceStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry enables PIM on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the interface.

hmPIMInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.name: hmPIMInterfaceJoinPruneInterval
hmPIMInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are transmitted on this PIM interface. The default value of this object is the hmPIMJoinPruneInterval.

hmPIMInterfaceCBSRPreference.name: hmPIMInterfaceCBSRPreference
hmPIMInterfaceCBSRPreference.description: The preference value for the local interface as a candidate bootstrap router. The value of -1 is used to indicate that the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

hmPIMNeighborTable.name: hmPIMNeighborTable
hmPIMNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors.

hmPIMNeighborEntry.name: hmPIMNeighborEntry
hmPIMNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMNeighborTable.

hmPIMNeighborAddress.name: hmPIMNeighborAddress
hmPIMNeighborAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry contains information.

hmPIMNeighborIfIndex.name: hmPIMNeighborIfIndex
hmPIMNeighborIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this PIM neighbor.

hmPIMNeighborUpTime.name: hmPIMNeighborUpTime
hmPIMNeighborUpTime.description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor of the local router.

hmPIMNeighborExpiryTime.name: hmPIMNeighborExpiryTime
hmPIMNeighborExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be aged out.

hmPIMNeighborMode.name: hmPIMNeighborMode
hmPIMNeighborMode.description: The active PIM mode of this neighbor. This object is deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by the protocol running on the interface.

hmPIMIpMRouteTable.name: hmPIMIpMRouteTable
hmPIMIpMRouteTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteTable defined in the IP Multicast MIB.

hmPIMIpMRouteEntry.name: hmPIMIpMRouteEntry
hmPIMIpMRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMIpMRouteTable. There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteTable whose incoming interface is running PIM.

hmPIMIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.name: hmPIMIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer
hmPIMIpMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description: The time remaining before the router changes its upstream neighbor back to its RPF neighbor. This timer is called the Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification. A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

hmPIMIpMRouteAssertMetric.name: hmPIMIpMRouteAssertMetric
hmPIMIpMRouteAssertMetric.description: The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

hmPIMIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.name: hmPIMIpMRouteAssertMetricPref
hmPIMIpMRouteAssertMetricPref.description: The preference advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

hmPIMIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.name: hmPIMIpMRouteAssertRPTBit
hmPIMIpMRouteAssertRPTBit.description: The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in effect.

hmPIMIpMRouteFlags.name: hmPIMIpMRouteFlags
hmPIMIpMRouteFlags.description: This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a multicast state entry. See the PIM Sparse Mode specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopTable.name: hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopTable
hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the ipMRouteNextHopTable defined in the IP Multicast MIB.

hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopEntry.name: hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopEntry
hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopTable. There is one entry per entry in the ipMRouteNextHopTable whose interface is running PIM and whose ipMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.name: hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason
hmPIMIpMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description: This object indicates why the downstream interface was pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to PIM Assert processing.

hmPIMRPTable.name: hmPIMRPTable
hmPIMRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM version 1 information for the Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups. This table is deprecated since its function is replaced by the hmPIMRPSetTable for PIM version 2.

hmPIMRPEntry.name: hmPIMRPEntry
hmPIMRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMRPTable. There is one entry per RP address for each IP multicast group.

hmPIMRPGroupAddress.name: hmPIMRPGroupAddress
hmPIMRPGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information about an RP.

hmPIMRPAddress.name: hmPIMRPAddress
hmPIMRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

hmPIMRPStateTimer.name: hmPIMRPStateTimer
hmPIMRPStateTimer.description: The minimum time remaining before the next state change. When hmPIMRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must expire until it can be declared down. When hmPIMRPState is down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in order to retry).

hmPIMRPLastChange.name: hmPIMRPLastChange
hmPIMRPLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding instance of hmPIMRPState last changed its value.

hmPIMRPRowStatus.name: hmPIMRPRowStatus
hmPIMRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which new entries may be created, or old entries deleted from this table.

hmPIMRPSetTable.name: hmPIMRPSetTable
hmPIMRPSetTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM information for candidate Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups. When the local router is the BSR, this information is obtained from received Candidate-RP-Advertisements. When the local router is not the BSR, this information is obtained from received RP-Set messages.

hmPIMRPSetEntry.name: hmPIMRPSetEntry
hmPIMRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMRPSetTable.

hmPIMRPSetGroupAddress.name: hmPIMRPSetGroupAddress
hmPIMRPSetGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with hmPIMRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

hmPIMRPSetGroupMask.name: hmPIMRPSetGroupMask
hmPIMRPSetGroupMask.description: The multicast group address mask which, when combined with hmPIMRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

hmPIMRPSetAddress.name: hmPIMRPSetAddress
hmPIMRPSetAddress.description: The IP address of the Candidate-RP.

hmPIMRPSetHoldTime.name: hmPIMRPSetHoldTime
hmPIMRPSetHoldTime.description: The holdtime of a Candidate-RP. If the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

hmPIMRPSetExpiryTime.name: hmPIMRPSetExpiryTime
hmPIMRPSetExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be declared down. If the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

hmPIMRPSetComponent.name: hmPIMRPSetComponent
hmPIMRPSetComponent.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value.

hmPIMCandidateRPTable.name: hmPIMCandidateRPTable
hmPIMCandidateRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for which the local router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP when the value of hmPIMComponentCRPHoldTime is non-zero. If this table is empty, then the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP for all groups (providing the value of hmPIMComponentCRPHoldTime is non- zero).

hmPIMCandidateRPEntry.name: hmPIMCandidateRPEntry
hmPIMCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMCandidateRPTable.

hmPIMCandidateRPGroupAddress.name: hmPIMCandidateRPGroupAddress
hmPIMCandidateRPGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with hmPIMCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

hmPIMCandidateRPGroupMask.name: hmPIMCandidateRPGroupMask
hmPIMCandidateRPGroupMask.description: The multicast group address mask which, when combined with hmPIMCandidateRPGroupMask, identifies a group prefix for which the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

hmPIMCandidateRPAddress.name: hmPIMCandidateRPAddress
hmPIMCandidateRPAddress.description: The (unicast) address of the interface which will be advertised as a Candidate-RP.

hmPIMCandidateRPRowStatus.name: hmPIMCandidateRPRowStatus
hmPIMCandidateRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which new entries may be created, or old entries deleted from this table.

hmPIMComponentTable.name: hmPIMComponentTable
hmPIMComponentTable.description: The (conceptual) table containing objects specific to a PIM domain. One row exists for each domain to which the router is connected. A PIM-SM domain is defined as an area of the network over which Bootstrap messages are forwarded. Typically, a PIM-SM router will be a member of exactly one domain. This table also supports, however, routers which may form a border between two PIM-SM domains and do not forward Bootstrap messages between them.

hmPIMComponentEntry.name: hmPIMComponentEntry
hmPIMComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hmPIMComponentTable.

hmPIMComponentIndex.name: hmPIMComponentIndex
hmPIMComponentIndex.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value. Routers that only support membership in a single PIM-SM domain should use a hmPIMComponentIndex value of 1.

hmPIMComponentBSRAddress.name: hmPIMComponentBSRAddress
hmPIMComponentBSRAddress.description: The IP address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local PIM region.

hmPIMComponentBSRExpiryTime.name: hmPIMComponentBSRExpiryTime
hmPIMComponentBSRExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in the local domain will be declared down. For candidate BSRs, this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set message. For other routers, this is the time until it may accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

hmPIMComponentCRPHoldTime.name: hmPIMComponentCRPHoldTime
hmPIMComponentCRPHoldTime.description: The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in the local domain. The value of 0 is used to indicate that the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

hmPIMComponentStatus.name: hmPIMComponentStatus
hmPIMComponentStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry creates another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a protocol instance.

hmPIMNeighborLoss.name: hmPIMNeighborLoss
hmPIMNeighborLoss.description: A hmPIMNeighborLoss trap signifies the loss of an adjacency with a neighbor. This trap should be generated when the neighbor timer expires, and the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with a lower IP address than itself.

hmPIMV1MIBCompliance.name: hmPIMV1MIBCompliance
hmPIMV1MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIMv1 and implementing the PIM MIB.

hmPIMSparseV2MIBCompliance.name: hmPIMSparseV2MIBCompliance
hmPIMSparseV2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM Sparse Mode and implementing the PIM MIB.

hmPIMDenseV2MIBCompliance.name: hmPIMDenseV2MIBCompliance
hmPIMDenseV2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM Dense Mode and implementing the PIM MIB.

hmPIMNotificationGroup.name: hmPIMNotificationGroup
hmPIMNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling important PIM events.

hmPIMV2MIBGroup.name: hmPIMV2MIBGroup
hmPIMV2MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM Sparse Mode (version 2) routers.

hmPIMDenseV2MIBGroup.name: hmPIMDenseV2MIBGroup
hmPIMDenseV2MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM Dense Mode (version 2) routers.

hmPIMV2CandidateRPMIBGroup.name: hmPIMV2CandidateRPMIBGroup
hmPIMV2CandidateRPMIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support configuration of which groups a router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

hmPIMV1MIBGroup.name: hmPIMV1MIBGroup
hmPIMV1MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM (version 1) routers.

hmPIMNextHopGroup.name: hmPIMNextHopGroup
hmPIMNextHopGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide per-next hop information for diagnostic purposes. Supporting this group may add a large number of instances to a tree walk, but the information in this group can be extremely useful in tracking down multicast connectivity problems.

hmPIMAssertGroup.name: hmPIMAssertGroup
hmPIMAssertGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide extra information about the assert election process. There is no protocol reason to keep such information, but some implementations may already keep this information and make it available. These objects can also be very useful in debugging connectivity or duplicate packet problems, especially if the assert winner does not support the PIM and IP Multicast MIBs.
